primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history to rectify/justify humanity through Christ, ending the reign of 'Religion' and 'Law' which hold the human will captive.

tekstueel_bewijs: God himself has acted to create a completely new situation.
The gospel is from beginning to end something that God does.
Jesus... is the power and the agent of God’s salvation.
the freedom we have in Christ Jesus
the balance sheet is made right in Christ
the God who called you in his grace
may it be the same for us
lead your daily life guided by the Spirit
Paul understands himself to have been directly commissioned
The Flesh is actively inclined against the Spirit
the enemy has seized an advantage
human wills are bound over to error
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological power ('The Flesh') that binds the human will, making self-rescue impossible.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer living a life guided by the Spirit as a consequence of being set right.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Rectified Person
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Right conduct / Freedom from impulsive desires
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is strictly a result of the primary program (soteriology). The Spirit leads the person because they are no longer under the Law.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we catch ourselves looking down on others

voorbeelden: knowing that racism is against the will of God
I never wanted to take drugs
most Episcopalians have no idea how foundational it is
if I could avoid procrastination... my problem would have been solved

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human LACK of power (impotence) and God's GIFT of power (grace). It rejects 'Devoir' (Law) as a means of salvation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Law/Judgment) through the negation of Niet-S1 (Religion is not enough) to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the judgment of S2, granting the freedom of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'balance sheet' and 'Judgment Day' are presented as inescapable realities.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly defines the gospel as 'something God does' and 'the end of religion,' placing the agency entirely on the Divine Subject.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I bear in my body scars... may it be the same for us.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The gospel is from beginning to end something that God does, not something that we do.
we live under the power of sin and death.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as a 'commander' or 'messenger,' but not as a moral example to be imitated by human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul is a recipient of grace whose will was bound until Christ freed him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-justification; 'liberation of the human spirit.'
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God is the sole author of the 'rectified' state.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a strict hierarchy where ethics (Spirit-led life) is the fruit, never the root, of justification.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'free will' in American culture and 'bound will' in Pauline theology.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the balance sheet is made right in Christ

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) that the Law could only provide as 'Devoir' (obligation).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; the will is 'bound' and cannot 'just say no.'

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this imbalance is theologically intentional to counter moralism.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Sin/Flesh) is already presented as an invincible cosmic power.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully deconstructs the 'Subject-Hearer' of moralism and replaces it with the 'Subject-God' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the NY Times as a hook, semiotics reveals that the news clipping serves as a 'Sender' of a specific value system (Justification).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what Paul meant; Greimassian analysis shows how the sermon's 'engine' actually functions to move the hearer from slavery to freedom.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Religion' is the primary 'Opponent' in this specific narrative structure, functioning as a false 'Helper'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'balance sheet' metaphor to ground the abstract concept of justification in a relatable 'Object' of desire.
